SEARCH
Module org.jandle
Package org.jandle.api.annotations

Annotation Interface HttpRequestFilters

@Retention(RUNTIME) @Target(TYPE) public @interface HttpRequestFilters
Attaches one or more HTTP filters to a request handler.

Filters declared via this annotation are executed in the order they are listed, before the handler logic is invoked.

Each filter class must provide a public no-argument constructor, as instances are created reflectively by the framework.

If a filter requires constructor arguments (e.g. configuration, services), it must be registered programmatically using JandleApplication.registerHandler(Handler handler, Filter... filters) instead of this annotation.

Example


 @HttpRequestFilters({
     AuthFilter.class,
     RateLimiter.class
 })
 public class ProtectedHandler implements Handler {
     // ...
 }

Filters with Constructors


 JandleApplication app = new JandleApplication();

 RateLimiter rateLimiter =
     new RateLimiter(tokenStorage, config);

 app.registerHandler(
     new MyHandler(),
     rateLimiter
 );
See Also:
  • JandleApplication

  • FilterChain

  • Required Element Summary

    Required Elements
    Modifier and Type
    Required Element
    Description
    Class<? extends Filter>[]
    value
    The filter classes to be applied to the annotated handler.

  • Element Details

    • value

      Class<? extends Filter>[] value
      The filter classes to be applied to the annotated handler.
      Returns:
      an array of filter classes
